For your information, up to the end of March, this is the data for our meals program:

Total meals served on Mainland 9,830
Total meals served on Ocracoke 766
For a total count of 10,596

Daily average meals delivered: 963

Meal counts have exceed 1000/day since 3/26 in a district with only 550 students, the smallest district in the state. That means we are feeding breakfast and lunch to over 90% of the children in Hyde County everyday!

This is outstanding! Please take a moment to thank the nutrition staff, bus drivers, Teacher Assistants , Transportation Director Tammy Sadler, Volunteers, when you see them.

Doing what's best for students!

Mr. Blackstock will be our Director of Instructional Programs and Assessments.

Instructional Programs constitute our Pre-K-13 classroom instruction and Career and Technical Education (CTE) courses. He is currently set to assume the Director’s position on January 22, 2020.

When introducing Mr. Blackstock to the Hyde County Board of Education this week, Superintendent Steve Basnight stated,

“We are honored to have a career educator with the knowledge and experience of Steve Blackstock! I have known Mr. Blackstock as an educator for a long time and have worked with him in both Dare and Currituck Counties. I was thrilled to have an opportunity to help him advance into district administration. Our data shows we made some incredible strides in our first year with Hyde County Schools and are committed to our goal of “Doing What’s Best for Students!” I know Steve believes in that same philosophy and he will be a tremendous asset to our leadership team!”

This will afford students in Hyde County the opportunity to pursue teaching degrees in elementary education, special education, & middle grades education in a little over 2 years. The majority of the courses will be taught in Community Colleges at Community College tuition rates saving students a lot of money in tuition.

The Pre-Kindergarten staff in our district had a wonderful back to school meeting. The Superintendent welcomed everyone and they received a pep talk from “Kid President”. The Children Quality Improvement Team from Beaufort Hyde Partnership shared some updates, health and safety information, and other valuable information. Our Licensing Consultant Lakisha Skinner and Tekisha Jordan, PreK Coordinator for the school system, also shared information. The Partnership did a presentation on "Play like a Child, Think like an Engineer". Also, they got to learn about Stem and Stream, and they were introduced to AR technology. The app overlays digital information onto the real world, using apps on smartphones and other devices. Augmented reality apps let users "see" through the cameras on their devices. The apps then add data delivered from the Internet to the image being shown.

The teachers enjoyed collaborating with one another… working together as a team… Working together to provide quality services to our early learners!
